version_description:
- We now support multitasking on iOS 9 devices.
- Users can now swipe between the Homescreen filters (Recent, Featured, Popular) on the iPhone version.
- Fixed a bug where audio from other apps would conflict with our podcasts.
- Various stability and bug fixes.

We appreciate your feedback. If you have a question or comment, email us at ios@slate.com.

Love the app? Help us out by leaving a review in the App Store.

We’re proud to introduce version 5.0 of our iOS app! We’ve rebuilt almost all of it (definitely the not so good parts, and even some of the pretty good parts) to deliver our content faster and more reliably to you, dear reader. As always, please email ios@slate.com with any feedback and bugs.

Here’s the full list enhancements, fixes, and new features we have for you:

- We’ve redesigned how podcasts live in the app: Now you can listen to podcasts in article pages and through the Podcasts section of the application. Tap into an episode to see the associated show notes as well.
- We’ve modified how the app loads our content, so our articles will now load super fast when you tap to read them.
- You can swipe between our section pages to find more content. You can also use the Menu to discover sections and blogs, like in previous versions.
- We gave the article pages a facelift to bring them more inline with our more recent mobile design work. You can pull down on the top images and tap the in-article images to expand them.
- Videos, tweets, and podcasts now load when we reference them in the text of an article.
- Text resizing has been moved to the toolbar in the article pages and will persist across articles in a better way than before.
- Slate Plus members: Log into the app to access Slate Plus content and now, Slate. Plus-only podcasts like our Slate Academy series and ad-free versions of all other Slate podcasts.
- Adopts iOS accessibility technologies to allow people with disabilities access to Slate’s content.

We’re proud to introduce version 5.0 of our iOS app! We’ve rebuilt almost all of it (definitely the not so good parts, and even some of the pretty good parts) to deliver our content faster and more reliably to you, dear reader. As always, please email ios@slate.com with any feedback and bugs.

Here’s the full list enhancements, fixes, and new features we have for you:

- We’ve redesigned how podcasts live in the app: Now you can listen to podcasts in article pages and through the Podcasts section of the application. Tap into an episode to see the associated show notes as well.
- We’ve modified how the app loads our content, so our articles will now load super fast when you tap to read them.
- You can swipe between our section pages to find more content. You can also use the Menu to discover sections and blogs, like in previous versions.
- We gave the article pages a facelift to bring them more inline with our more recent mobile design work. You can pull down on the top images and tap the in-article images to expand them.
- Videos, tweets, and podcasts now load when we reference them in the text of an article.
- Text resizing has been moved to the toolbar in the article pages and will persist across articles in a better way than before.
- Slate Plus members: Log into the app to access Slate Plus content and now, Slate. Plus-only podcasts like our Slate Academy series and ad-free versions of all other Slate podcasts.
- Adopts iOS accessibility technologies to allow people with disabilities access to Slate’s content.

Thank you for all your feedback! You've emailed to tell us you prefer the RECENT section as the default landing page in the iPhone version and the app can be very slow to load, especially on older devices. Both of those items have been addressed in this release.

In addition, we've included the following items:

- Added a scroll bar to the article pages.
- Modified the background color and labeling around our ads to make it more clear they are actually ads.
- Fixed a bug where the app would appear to hang after tapping Slate links from outside the app.
- Other minor bugs.

Thank you for all your feedback! You've emailed to tell us you prefer the RECENT section as the default landing page in the iPhone version and the app can be very slow to load, especially on older devices. Both of those items have been addressed in this release.

In addition, we've included the following items:

- Added a scroll bar to the article pages.
- Modified the background color and labeling around our ads to make it more clear they are actually ads.
- Fixed a bug where the app would appear to hang after tapping Slate links from outside the app.
- Other minor bugs.

- Fixed a bug where the subheadlines on the iPad homepage would not update when the app is refreshed.
- Other minor bug fixes.

- Fixed a bug where the subheadlines on the iPad homepage would not update when the app is refreshed.
- Other minor bug fixes.

Now you can try Slate Plus free for 90 days when you support our independent journalism with an annual subscription. With Slate Plus, you'll get:

- Exclusive stories
- More of your favorite podcasts
- Extra Dear Prudence
- No ads anywhere in this app

In addition, this version of the app contains:

- A fix to a bug that would prevent content from loading in some situations
- A new push notification service. We're sorry for the interruption. We look forward to judiciously sending push notifications to you.
- Other minor bug fixes

Now you can try Slate Plus free for 90 days when you support our independent journalism with an annual subscription. With Slate Plus, you'll get:

- Exclusive stories
- More of your favorite podcasts
- Extra Dear Prudence
- No ads anywhere in this app

In addition, this version of the app contains:

- A fix to a bug that would prevent content from loading in some situations
- A new push notification service. We're sorry for the interruption. We look forward to judiciously sending push notifications to you.
- Other minor bug fixes

- Hopefully fixed an issue where some stories would go missing from our Index pages
- Fixed an issue where the app would crash after posting a comment
- Fixed an issue where the login/create overlay would not collapse after a successful account log in or creation. Users also might have seen an odd error message in this particular case.
- Fixed an issue that prevented us from sending push notifications to those who have opted in
- Other minor styling issues and bugs

- Hopefully fixed an issue where some stories would go missing from our Index pages
- Fixed an issue where the app would crash after posting a comment
- Fixed an issue where the login/create overlay would not collapse after a successful account log in or creation. Users also might have seen an odd error message in this particular case.
- Fixed an issue that prevented us from sending push notifications to those who have opted in
- Other minor styling issues and bugs

We apologize for the crashing issue some users ran into with our last release. Please update to this version and email ios@slate.com if you have trouble.

This build includes minor bug fixes.

We apologize for the crashing issue some users ran into with our last release. Please update to this version and email ios@slate.com if you have trouble.

This build includes minor bug fixes.

We apologize again for the crashing issue some of you are running into. To be transparent, we're having a difficult time reproducing the problem and this build reverts all of the changes we made in app version 5.1.1, which is when the crashing started.

Please continue to email ios@slate.com with questions, issues, or feedback.

We apologize again for the crashing issue some of you are running into. To be transparent, we're having a difficult time reproducing the problem and this build reverts all of the changes we made in app version 5.1.1, which is when the crashing started.

Please continue to email ios@slate.com with questions, issues, or feedback.

Thanks to our amazing readers who helped us troubleshoot the app crashing issue. We believe it is resolved in this release.

In addition, the following items are included in this release:

- Fixes an issue where some blocks of stories would go missing from our index pages
- Fixes a crashing issue that affected some users when posting a comment
- Fixes an issue where our sign in screen would not collapse when some users logged in
- A couple fixes around receiving push notifications
- A few more miscellaneous crash fixes and enhancements

As always, please email ios@slate.com if you run into any trouble.

- Fixes an issue with Google authentication
- Introduces overall stability improvements to the create account / login flow
- Other minor enhancements and bug fixes

If you have a question or issue, please email us at ios@slate.com. If you enjoy the app, please leave us a positive review!

- Fixes an issue with Google authentication
- Introduces overall stability improvements to the create account / login flow
- Other minor enhancements and bug fixes

If you have a question or issue, please email us at ios@slate.com. If you enjoy the app, please leave us a positive review!

In addition to some crash fixes, we've added a couple highly requested features in this version:

- Added audio scrubbing from the podcast detail page
- If you pause a podcast then leave the app, the app will preserve your place in the podcast when you open the app again

Please email ios@slate.com if you run into any trouble. If you like the app, please leave us a positive review in the App Store. We have more audio improvements coming in future versions!

Thanks for reading and listening.

This version includes the first set of changes for our rebrand. Check out slate.com for more! This build also includes:

- Our new sections and subsections in the menu and swipe-able left and right
- We've removed TOP STORIES for now. We found it was highly duplicative with the POPULAR and RECENT sections. Stay tuned for a replacement in an upcoming release.
- Fixed a few bugs and app crashes

We've gotten emails about a few bugs that we're going to be addressing in very quickly:

1. Comments missing from new stories
2. Some images missing from new stories
3. The timestamp on newer articles is in GMT

Thanks as always for using the app. Please don't hesitate to reach out with questions or feedback at ios@slate.com. And if you like the app or Slate generally, please leave us a positive review. They really help!

- Fixes article timestamps to reflect the device's timezone

- Updates for the EU's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Visitors from the EU (only) will be presented information about Slate's use of your data with the ability to opt-in and continue using the app. We'll provide links to our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy as well, which are also below.

https://slate.com/terms
https://slate.com/privacy

This is important!

We've added a headphones icon to the top right area of the app that will direct you to the podcasts section. This replaces the need to navigate to the Podcasts section then tap ALL SHOWS. We hope it gets you to your Slate podcasts a little bit faster and easier.

Note: all of the audio playing functionality for Slate Plus members and non-members stays the same. You can continue to find show notes by tapping into each episode.

This is important!

We've added a headphones icon to the top right area of the app that will direct you to the podcasts section. This replaces the need to navigate to the Podcasts section then tap ALL SHOWS. We hope it gets you to your Slate podcasts a little bit faster and easier.

Note: all of the audio playing functionality for Slate Plus members and non-members stays the same. You can continue to find show notes by tapping into each episode.

- Fixed an issue with our GDPR opt-in that made EU some users see a 404 page
- Added PODCASTS back to the Menu at the top (above RECENT)
- For Slate Plus members: we reworked how your ad-free podcast feeds are delivered to the app. When the app recognizes you are a Plus member, you'll see the podcast tile artwork switch to the SLATE PLUS version so you'll know you are getting the ad-free version. Those feeds should load more reliably now as well.

- Fixed an issue with our GDPR opt-in that made EU some users see a 404 page
- Added PODCASTS back to the Menu at the top (above RECENT)
- For Slate Plus members: we reworked how your ad-free podcast feeds are delivered to the app. When the app recognizes you are a Plus member, you'll see the podcast tile artwork switch to the SLATE PLUS version so you'll know you are getting the ad-free version. Those feeds should load more reliably now as well.
